required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety and Efficacy of BGS649 in Obese, Hypogonadotropic Hypogonadal Men
clinical_study.official_title: An Open-label Dose Finding Study Followed by a Parallel Group, Randomized, Double-blind Study to Evaluate the Safety, Tolerability and Pharmacodynamics of 12 Week BGS649 Treatment in Obese, Hypogonadotropic Hypogonadal Men

brief_summary.textblock: This study is designed as a 2-part study, with Part 1 being open-label to best determine the appropriate dose levels to use in Part 2, which has a randomized, double-blind, placebo controlled design. The study aims to assess the safety and tolerability of BGS649, and determine whether or not BGS649 is able to normalize testosterone levels and improve insulin sensitivity in obese, hypogonadotropic hypogonadal (OHH) men

study_design_info.masking_description: Open-label in Part 1 and double-blind in Part 2.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Patients Achieving Normal Testosterone Levels
primary_outcome.description: Percentage of patients achieving normal testosterone (2.50 - 9.50 ng/mL) levels at Week 4 and Week 12

primary_outcome.measure: Part 2: Change From Baseline at Homeostatic Model Assessment of Insulin Resistance (HOMA-IR & QUICKI Scores) at Week 4 and 12
primary_outcome.description: Pharmacodynamic change from baseline in HOMA-IR. Score at week 4 and week 12 as an assessment of insulin resistance. Low score representing high insulin sensitivity and a high score representing low insulin sensitivity or insulin resistance. HOMA-IR is a ration of Fasting insulin (mIU/L) : Fasting glucose (mmol). Pharmacodynamic change in QUICKI score at week 4 and week 12 as an assessment of insulin resistance. The QUICKI scale is a log score and a high score representing high insulin sensitivity and low score indicating low insulin sensitivity. Patients with a score below 0.3 are considered diabetic. Week 12 data is missing because there were inaccuracies in dosing of patients and so the study was terminated, only safety data was collected.

secondary_outcome.measure: Part 2: Area Under the Concentration-time Curve From Time Zero to Time 't' (AUC0-168)
secondary_outcome.description: PK sampling was performed at 0hr (pre-dose), 1 hr, 8 hr, 24 hr, 72 hr, and 168 hr on the following occasions Week 1, Week 4 and week 11. The AUC 0-168 measures the amount of drug within the subjects blood over the 168h post-dosing at these timepoints.

secondary_outcome.measure: Part 2: Pharmacokinetics of BGS649: Maximum (Peak) Observed Blood Drug Concentration After Single Dose Administration (Cmax)
secondary_outcome.description: PK sampling was performed at 0hr (pre-dose), 1 hr, 8 hr, 24 hr, 72 hr, and 168 hr on the following occasions Week 1, Week 4 and week 11.

secondary_outcome.measure: Part 2: Pharmacokinetics of BGS649: Time to Reach Maximum (Peak) Blood Drug Concentration After Single Dose Administration (Tmax)
secondary_outcome.description: PK sampling was performed at 0hr (pre-dose), 1 hr, 8 hr, 24 hr, 72 hr, and 168 hr on the following occasions Week 1, Week 4 and week 11.

secondary_outcome.measure: PK of BGS649 Elimination Half-life Associated With the Terminal Slope of a Semi Logarithmic Concentration-time Curve (T1/2)
secondary_outcome.description: PK sampling was performed at 0hr (pre-dose), 1 hr, 8 hr, 24 hr, 72 hr, and 168 hr on the following occasions Week 1, Week 4 and week 11.

arm_group.description: BGS649 1mg and 0.1mg in hard gelatin capsules. In part 1 there was individualised dosing to titrate the subject's testosterone into the normal range. If the dose was lower than 0.1mg then specific instructions for dilution of an oral solution of BGS649 were provided.
Matching placebo to BGS649 (0.3 and 0.1mg). 0.3mg placebo capsule given on Day 1 and 0.1mg placebo capsule on other treatment visits (week 1 to 11).
0.3 or 0.1mg hard gelatin capsules of BGS649 given orally. 0.3mg on Day 1 and 0.1 on all other treatment visits (week 1 to 11).

intervention.intervention_name: Investigational new drug company code: BGS649

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Males who meet the criteria of obese, hypogonadotropic hypogonadism defined as:
- Patients with a Body Mass Index (BMI) ≥ 30 kg/m2
- Patients with a morning serum total testosterone level < 300 ng/dL on at least two separate occasions during the Screening and/or Baseline periods.
- Patients with inappropriately low gonadotropins at screening given the low testosterone:
- Luteinizing hormone (LH) ≤ ULN
- Follicle stimulating hormone (FSH) ≤ ULN
- Estradiol within or above the normal range (defined as ≥ LLN of the approved assay)
- Normal hypothalamic/pituitary function, including:
- Prolactin: within the normal range
- Thyroid stimulating hormone (TSH): within the normal range
- Ferritin: within the normal range
- Patients agree to use a barrier method of contraception (e.g., condom), for the duration of the study and for at least 3 months following their Study Completion visit to prevent BGS649 exposure to their partners.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with hypogonadism, not related to obesity or as a result of other underlying issues
- Patients with significant major organ class illness (e.g. kidney or liver disease).
- Other protocol-defined inclusion/exclusion criteria may apply

participant_flow.recruitment_details: 14 participants enrolled in Part 1 and 15 participants enrolled in part 2.

group.title: BGS649 Part 1
group.description: BGS649 1mg and 0.1mg in hard gelatin capsules. In part 1 there was individualised dosing to titrate the subject's testosterone into the normal range. If the dose was lower than 0.1mg then specific instructions for dilution of an oral solution of BGS649 were provided.

group.title: BGS649 Part 2
group.description: BGS649 0.3mg hard gelatin capsule given orally on Day 1 and 0.1mg BGS649 capsule on other treatment visits (week 1 to 11).

group.title: Placebo to BGS649
group.description: Matching placebo to BGS649 (0.3 and 0.1mg). 0.3mg placebo capsule given on Day 1 and 0.1mg placebo capsule on other treatment visits (week 1 to 11).

group.title: BGS649 (Part 1)
group.description: BGS649 1mg and 0.1mg in hard gelatin capsules. In part 1 there was individualised dosing to titrate the subject's testosterone into the normal range. If the dose was lower than 0.1mg then specific instructions for dilution of an oral solution of BGS649 were provided.

group.title: BGS649 (Part 2)
group.description: BGS649 0.3mg hard gelatin capsule given orally on Day 1 and 0.1mg BGS649 capsule on other treatment visits (week 1 to 11).

group.title: Placebo to BGS649 (Part 2)
group.description: Matching placebo to BGS649 (0.3 and 0.1mg). 0.3mg placebo capsule given on Day 1 and 0.1mg placebo capsule on other treatment visits (week 1 to 11).

measure.title: Age
measure.description: Age calculate from date of birth at time of consent
measure.population: Part 1 and Part 2 results were analysed completed separately throughout the study

measure.title: Sex: Female, Male
measure.population: Part 1 and Part 2 patients were analysed completed separately throughout the study

measure.title: Race/Ethnicity, Customized
measure.population: Part 1 and Part 2 of the study were reported/analysed separately and so combined totals are not available

measure.title: Body Mass Index
measure.population: Part A and Part B were analysed and reported separately in the study

outcome.title: Percentage of Patients Achieving Normal Testosterone Levels
outcome.description: Percentage of patients achieving normal testosterone (2.50 - 9.50 ng/mL) levels at Week 4 and Week 12
outcome.population: Number/percentage of patients achieving normal sex hormone levels at Week 4 and Week 12 (Part 1 Only)

group.title: BGS649 (Part 1)
group.description: BGS649 1mg and 0.1mg in hard gelatin capsules. In part 1 there was individualised dosing to titrate the subject's testosterone into the normal range. If the dose was lower than 0.1mg then specific instructions for dilution of an oral solution of BGS649 were provided.

measure.title: Percentage of Patients Achieving Normal Testosterone Levels
measure.description: Percentage of patients achieving normal testosterone (2.50 - 9.50 ng/mL) levels at Week 4 and Week 12
measure.population: Number/percentage of patients achieving normal sex hormone levels at Week 4 and Week 12 (Part 1 Only)

outcome.title: Part 2: Change From Baseline at Homeostatic Model Assessment of Insulin Resistance (HOMA-IR & QUICKI Scores) at Week 4 and 12
outcome.description: Pharmacodynamic change from baseline in HOMA-IR. Score at week 4 and week 12 as an assessment of insulin resistance. Low score representing high insulin sensitivity and a high score representing low insulin sensitivity or insulin resistance. HOMA-IR is a ration of Fasting insulin (mIU/L) : Fasting glucose (mmol). Pharmacodynamic change in QUICKI score at week 4 and week 12 as an assessment of insulin resistance. The QUICKI scale is a log score and a high score representing high insulin sensitivity and low score indicating low insulin sensitivity. Patients with a score below 0.3 are considered diabetic. Week 12 data is missing because there were inaccuracies in dosing of patients and so the study was terminated, only safety data was collected.
outcome.population: Could not be analysed due to drug administration errors. Week 12 data is missing because they were inaccuracies in the dosing of patients and so the study was terminated early and efficacy data not reported for the affected patients.

group.title: BGS649 Part 2
group.description: BGS649 0.3mg hard gelatin capsule given orally on Day 1 and 0.1mg BGS649 capsule on other treatment visits (week 1 to 11).

group.description: Matching placebo to BGS649 (0.3 and 0.1mg). 0.3mg placebo capsule given on Day 1 and 0.1mg placebo capsule on other treatment visits (week 1 to 11).

Pharmacodynamic change in QUICKI score at week 4 and week 12 as an assessment of insulin resistance. The QUICKI scale is a log score and a high score representing high insulin sensitivity and low score indicating low insulin sensitivity. Patients with a score below 0.3 are considered diabetic. Week 12 data is missing because there were inaccuracies in dosing of patients and so the study was terminated, only safety data was collected.

outcome.description: PK sampling was performed at 0hr (pre-dose), 1 hr, 8 hr, 24 hr, 72 hr, and 168 hr on the following occasions Week 1, Week 4 and week 11. The AUC 0-168 measures the amount of drug within the subjects blood over the 168h post-dosing at these timepoints.
outcome.population: PK Analysis Set included 7 patients given BGS649 in Part 2.

outcome.title: PK of BGS649 Elimination Half-life Associated With the Terminal Slope of a Semi Logarithmic Concentration-time Curve (T1/2)
outcome.description: PK sampling was performed at 0hr (pre-dose), 1 hr, 8 hr, 24 hr, 72 hr, and 168 hr on the following occasions Week 1, Week 4 and week 11.
outcome.population: PK Analysis Set. Sparse PK sampling (4 samples over 672 h) was included for the PK profile for Week 4; Cmax was included in λz estimation, therefore T1/2 was not reported for all profiles in Week 4.

group.description: BGS649 0.3mg hard gelatin capsule given orally on Day 1 and 0.1mg BGS649 capsule on other treatment visits (week 1 to 11).

measure.population: PK Analysis Set. Sparse PK sampling (4 samples over 672 h) was included for the PK profile for Week 4; Cmax was included in λz estimation, therefore T1/2 was not reported for all profiles in Week 4.

reported_events.desc: Does not differ to clinicaltrials.gov. definitions

group.title: BGS649 (Part 1) Open Label
group.description: Individualised doses to titrate testosterone levels to within normal range. Doses ranged between 0.003mg and 5mg in total over the 11 week treatment period. For doses below 0.1mg, separate pharmacy instructions were provided to dilute an oral solution of BGS649.

group.title: BGS649 (Part 2)
group.description: All subjects were given 0.3mg on Day 1 and then 0.1mg on all other dosing visits (weeks 2-11).

group.title: Placebo to BGS649 (Part 2)
group.description: Matching placebo capsules on Day 1 and all other dosing visits (weeks 2-11).

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)
Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: All PIs must seek written permission from the sponsor prior to publication of any trial results.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: Part 2 of the study was early terminated due to incorrect dosing, therefore only 8 of the 15 subjects enrolled completed 11 doses of treatment, and the remaining 7 subjects had incomplete dosing.
